intro.title: What is AI Image Splitter?
intro.content: AI Image Splitter is a professional online image splitting tool designed specifically for social media content creators. Whether you want to create Instagram grid layouts, Facebook carousel posts, or other platforms' multi-image displays, our tool helps you achieve it effortlessly.

stepByStep.title: Complete Operation Steps
stepByStep.subtitle: Follow this detailed guide to master professional image splitting in 5 minutes

step1.title: Step 1: Visit Website and Upload Image
step1.content: Enter {domainLink} in your browser to access our homepage. You can upload images through these two methods:
step1.method1: **Drag & Drop**: Directly drag image files to the upload area
step1.method2: **Click Upload**: Click the 'Choose Image' button to select from your device
step1.note: Supports JPG, PNG, GIF and other mainstream formats, maximum file size 50MB

step2.title: Step 2: Select Splitting Mode
step2.content: Choose the appropriate splitting method based on your needs:

vertical.name: Vertical Split
vertical.description: Suitable for creating carousel posts, vertically splits images into multiple strip parts
vertical.useCase: Perfect for Instagram and Facebook carousel displays

horizontal.name: Horizontal Split
horizontal.description: Horizontally splits images, suitable for horizontal display needs
horizontal.useCase: Ideal for creating timeline effects or step-by-step displays

grid.name: Grid Split
grid.description: Splits images into grid layouts, the most popular Instagram display method

step3.title: Step 3: Set Splitting Parameters
step3.content: Adjust corresponding parameters based on the selected mode:
step3.setting1: **Vertical Split**: Set number of columns (recommended 3-6 columns)
step3.setting2: **Horizontal Split**: Set number of rows (recommended 2-4 rows)
step3.setting3: **Grid Split**: Customize rows and columns (3×3 is most popular)
step3.preview: The right preview area displays splitting effects in real-time, helping you adjust to the optimal state

step4.title: Step 4: Adjust Split Line Width
step4.content: Use the split line width slider to adjust the thickness of grid lines:
step4.tip1: **Thin lines (1-2px)**: Suitable for refined, minimalist design styles
step4.tip2: **Medium lines (3-4px)**: Balanced visual effects, suitable for most situations
step4.tip3: **Thick lines (5-6px)**: Emphasizes splitting effects, suitable for artistic creation

step5.title: Step 5: Select Output Format
step5.content: Choose the appropriate image format based on usage scenarios:

formats.jpg: Smaller file size, suitable for web sharing

step6.title: Step 6: Download Split Results
step6.content: After completing the split, you have two download options:
step6.option1: **Single Download**: Hover over any grid and click the download button to get a single image
step6.option2: **Batch Download**: Click the 'Download Images' button to download all split results as a ZIP archive

step7.title: Step 7: Re-upload or Continue Processing
step7.content: To process other images, click the 'Re-upload Image' button to start a new splitting task.

bestPractices.title: Professional Usage Tips
bestPractices.subtitle: Enhance your social media content quality

tip1.title: Choose High-Quality Original Images
tip1.content: Use images with at least 1080×1080 resolution to ensure each split part remains clear and visible

tip2.title: Consider Composition Integrity
tip2.content: Pre-visualize each grid's content before splitting to avoid cutting important elements

tip3.title: Maintain Consistent Publishing Order
tip3.content: Instagram grids work best when published in order from left to right, top to bottom

tip4.title: Test Different Splitting Schemes
tip4.content: Try different row and column combinations to find the best splitting method for your images

q4.question: Can I use this on mobile devices?
q4.answer: Of course! Our website uses responsive design and works perfectly on phones, tablets, and computers.
